page.title: 03A TRIP WITH THE"RESEARCH"
page.content: I was off with the Research.We left the pier and steamed for 24hours.We sailed north then west through Yell Sound turning south westerly and sailing until we were off Foula.Then we switched on the sonars and meters and found a mark, this is what meter readings for a shoal of fish is called.While the net was shot the boat steamed in a wide circle and came back to the buoy on the end of the net rope .This was taken aboard and the ropes winched in.The rope on the net bottom was pulled tight"pursing" the net.The fish were trapped.The net was brought alongside,the fish pump was lowered into the net and the catch pumped aboard.In one shot 60tonnes of herring were caught. After one more shot the total,110 tonnes, was enough to trip to Denmark with.The catch sold for about Â£25 000.
